titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Louise P. Latimer's Washington Yours and Mine materials collection, circa 1921 MS2353
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-18 12:03:16 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Louise P. Latimer's Washington Yours and Mine materials collection
did.abstract: Louise Payson Latimer (1878-1962) was an author and Director of Work for Children at the District of Columbia Public Library. She is the author of Your Washington and Mine and also Illustrators of Children's Books, 1744-1945.. The collection contains photographs and correspondence related to the writing of Washington Yours and Mine. The letters are from Ms. Latimer to various copyright holders seeking approval to publish an image in the book. The images are not dated, but the book was published in 1924 making the images older than 1924. The letters date from 1921 through 1922.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Louise Payson Latimer (1878-1962) was an author and Director of Work for Children at the District of Columbia Public Library. She is the author of Your Washington and Mine and also Illustrators of Children's Books, 1744-1945. Ms. Latimer was the daughter of Thomas Wilmer and Mary Josephine Latimer, the sister of Adm. Julian Lane Latimer, Mary Jane Latimer, and John Wilmer Latimer.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in orginal order. The photographs are often placed in front of a sheet of paper. This sheet of paper often has descriptive information and sometimes information about the photographer and/or image owner. The original order was maintain thus the page numbers often written on the sheets of paper do not correspond to the order of the materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs and correspondence related to the writing of Washington Yours and Mine by Louise P. Latimer. The letters are from Ms. Latimer to various copyright holders seeking approval to publish an image in the book. The images are primarily of the built environment in the District. It is unknown if all of these images were used in the book. The images are not dated, but the book was published in 1924 making the images older than 1924. The letters date from 1921 through 1922.

During her research for Washington Yours and Mine, Latimer mentions making extensive use of the books, local newspapers, and clippings and pamphlet collections in the Washingtoniana division at the DC public library.

did.unittitle: Photographs for Your Washington and Mine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images in this folder include: The U.S. Capitol, C&O Canal, Union Station Plaza, the Cathedral of Sts. Peter and Paul, the Bulfinch Gateway, White House (interior and exterior), Patent Office building, Washington Monument, Library of Congress reading room, Freer Gallery of Art, the Court of the Pan - American Union Fountain, National Headquarters of the Daughters of the American Revolution, Carlyle House, New Hampshire Avenue, Scottish Rites Temple, U.S. Naval Hospital, Corcoran Gallery of Art.

did.unittitle: Photographs and correspondence for Your Washington and Mine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images in this folder include: Pierce Mill, top mast of the United States battleship Maine, Old Fort Washington, Municipal Building of the District, Cabin John Bridge, house opposite Ford's Theater, Central High School, Cnduit Road School, the Ampitheater at Arlington Cemetery, United States Treasury building, Mount Vernon, the House Office building, Aztec God in Pan American Gardens, Library of Congress, White House, Bellevue house, 2107-2117 Pennsylvania Avenue, Patent Office building, Tomb of L'Enfant, Woodley House, Freer Gallery, Pan-American Union Building, House on 2nd and B streets NE, American Red Cross Headquarters, Corcoran Gallery grand stairway, Octagon Building vestibule, Washington's headquarters in Georgetown (3049 M. Street NW), St. John's Episcopal Church (16th and H street NW), Thomas Circle, East Potomac Park,

did.unittitle: Photographs and correspondence for Your Washington and Mine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images in this folder include: Lincoln Memorial, Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, Dupont Circle Memorial Fountain, "Travelling through life" a memorial in Rock Creek Cemetery, Memorial to Mrs. Henry Adams, aerial image of the Mall and monument gardens, Harpers Ferry, Great Falls of the Potomac, Christ Church Alexandria, Carlyle House, Woodlawn house, Public library at 9th and NY Avenue NW, Court House, Mount Vernon, Arlington House, Arlington Cemetery, Van Ness Mosoleum, and Tudor Place
